's mom heard a ringing sound. It was her phone. She answered it and realized that she had to pick up some medicine urgently.
Jack's mom said, "Jack! We have to go now! We have to get some medicine!" 
Jack said, "Why do we need medicine?"
"We need it because we have to be very careful about keeping ourselves healthy," his mom replied.
So Jack and his family hopped in the car and drove to the pharmacy. They picked up the medicine and soon were back in the park. The sun was still shining bright yellow, and they had lots of fun.

Henry was running down the street, feeling very hot. He stopped outside the hospital and saw a police officer, standing next to a car. The policeman was talking on the radio, but he noticed Henry and called out to him.
"You need to pay. You can't go in the hospital right now," said the policeman.
Henry frowned. He really wanted to get inside.
"But I'm looking for my mom!" he said.

The jelly started to rot. It got all smelly and yucky. It started to get dry and hard. 
The little jelly began to wobble. Then it suddenly shook. It started to get bigger and bigger and bigger! Then it made a scary noise. 
The little jelly was so scared so it ran away. It ran as fast as it could and it ran and ran until it found a safe place to hide. Then, the little jelly was safe and it never had to worry about being scared again.
